channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Costco’s controversial new policy says something worrying about the economy
item.description: Costco is famously adored by its fans, and its leadership wants the discount big-box chain to remain beloved. Costco co-founder and former CEO James S...

item.title: Why the perfect is so often the enemy of the good
item.description: One of the most striking aspects of Sarah Wynn-Williams ’s best-selling memoir, Careless People , about her years at Meta, is the way she portrays She...

item.title: Goldman and Morgan Stanley CEOs predict corrections of up to 20%, sparking global selloff
item.description: Wall Street expects tech stocks to take a hammering this morning.

item.title: Starbucks sells 60% of China unit to Boyu at $4 billion value
item.description: Luckin Coffee dethroned Starbucks as China’s biggest coffee chain two years ago by selling coffee at one-third of its price.

item.title: The Case For Nepotism in Family Businesses
item.description: A business advisor shares why ‘keeping it in the family’ can be an effective succession plan.

item.title: Hotels are now the hottest real estate for converted housing
item.description: More buildings are being converted into apartments in the U.S. than ever before, and it’s not just old offices that are finding new use. After the COV...

item.title: How human expertise is quietly powering AI
item.description: In recent years, leading artificial intelligence labs and startups have released AI software designed for tasks of ever-growing complexity, including ...

item.title: 7 Black Friday Deals You Can Get Right Now to Upgrade Your Office
item.description: Computers, monitors, and other productivity devices are already on sale. Plus, a bargain on a PlayStation.

item.title: Some CEOs have vowed to revolt against a Zohran Mamdani win. Jamie Dimon says he’ll ‘call him and offer my help’
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Childcare is so expensive many families are just giving up now, forcing them to sacrifice incomes, savings, and careers
item.description: Bank of America found a 1.6% annual decline in the number of households making monthly payments in September.

item.title: The Economy Seems Uncertain. Here’s Why Entrepreneurs Remain Optimistic
item.description: New survey data shows small business owners are upbeat about their own prospects, despite higher tariff costs and murky economic forecasts.

item.title: Why the Job Market Is Deteriorating So Much Right Now
item.description: The labor market faces a pullback from AI, the Fed and macro headwinds.

item.title: Tala Health raises $100 million seed round, as Ritankar Das seeks to build a holding company for the AI era
item.description: Titan Holdings has launched a new operating company, Tala Health, Fortune has exclusively learned.

item.title: The workday is becoming infinite. Microsoft warns it’s time to set new boundaries
